headline: S&P 500's breakout May was largely a result of Mag 7 gains
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) clocked its best month of trading in May since 1990, and the majority of the Magnificent Seven — comprised of tech stocks Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — may be deserving of some of the credit. Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman recaps the Mag 7 stock gains and how it contributed to the S&P 500's breakout May. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman recaps the Mag 7 stock gains and how it contributed to the S&P 500's breakout May. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Commentary: Why businesses want to blame Trump for price hikes
summary: Businesses suffer when customers blame them for price hikes. That's why they're willing to call out Trump's tariffs as the cause.

headline: Amazon set to expand robotics push to cut labor reliance
summary: Investing.com -- Amazon.com is accelerating its robotics rollout across its fulfillment and delivery operations, a move Bank of America says could unlock up to $16 billion in annual cost savings by 2032 and significantly reduce the company’s labor dependence.

headline: Lawsuit alleges Amazon denied leave to worker with ectopic pregnancy
summary: The worker claimed Amazon violated the PWFA, the ADA and the FMLA when it denied her request for leave and then fired her without engaging in any interactive process.

headline: 4 Monster Stocks to Buy and Hold for the Next Decade
summary: Microsoft’s AI and cloud business is growing at a rapid pace.  Meta’s AI investments are translating into deeper user engagement and higher advertising revenue.  Amazon and Vertex are rapidly building wealth for investors.

headline: Billionaire Bill Ackman Wants to Be the Next Warren Buffett, and He Is Buying an AI Stock Up 855% in 10 Years (Hint: Not Nvidia)
summary: Billionaire Bill Ackman will turn Howard Hughes Holdings into a modern-day Berkshire Hathaway in an effort to recreate Warren Buffett's success.  Ackman's hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management recently took a stake in Amazon, an artificial intelligence stock up 855% in the last decade.  Amazon has three major growth opportunities in e-commerce, digital advertising, and cloud computing, and the company is using AI to boost revenue and improve margins.

headline: Triata Capital: Bullish on PDD
summary: Sean Ho, Founder & CIO at Triata Capital, discusses why he sees further upside for PDD despite risks from US-China tensions. The US-listed Chinese e-commerce firm was Ho's investment pick at this year's Sohn Hong Kong Investment Leaders Conference. He speaks with Yvonne Man and Annabelle Droulers on "Bloomberg The China Show."
